org.clapper.util.classutil

Class MethodInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.clapper.util.classutil.MethodInfo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<MethodInfo>

    public class MethodInfo
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<MethodInfo>
    Holds information about a method within a class.
    See Also:
    ClassInfo

      Create and initialize a new MethodInfo object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MethodInfo

        public MethodInfo()
        Create a new, empty MethodInfo object.

      • MethodInfo

        public MethodInfo(int access,
          java.lang.String name,
          java.lang.String description,
          java.lang.String signature,
          java.lang.String[] exceptions)
        Create and initialize a new MethodInfo object.
        Parameters:
        access - method access modifiers, etc.
        name - method name
        description - method description
        signature - method signature
        exceptions - list of thrown exceptions (by name)

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(MethodInfo other)
        Compare this object and another MethodInfo object. The two objects are compared by their signature fields.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<MethodInfo>
        Parameters:
        other - the other object
        Returns:
        a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer, as this object is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified object.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        Compare this object to another one for equality. If the other object is a MethodInfo instance, the two will be compared by signature.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        other - the other object
        Returns:
        true if other is a MethodInfo object and it has the same signature as this object, false otherwise.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Return a string representation of the method. Currently, the string representation is just the method's signature, or the name if the signature is null.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation
